text:
The owners are super nice and the food is delicious. We have tried the pad thai, panang curry, pineapple fried rice, golden purses and fried spinach and it was all really good. Curry is spicier than other places.

We actually like the smaller portions (although you can get full portions too) and we don't mind paying a premium for a great place in our neighborhood. The food is very fresh, which is awesome.

I cannot rave enough about this place. My husband and I eat here multiple times a week. We began going to this place right when it opened and coincidentally right before we took a trip to Thailand. Jen and her entire family (the owners) are amazingly friendly and have memorized our order - red curry with chicken/crispy tofu and brown rice AND, my favorite, a papaya salad - YUM!!! We've also ordered many other things on the menu which are fabulous as well. The crispy spinach is a great little snack. 

After traveling to Thailand and coming back, her food is exactly what we had there. Every time we go it reminds us of the Thai cuisine and our trip. I'm so happy to have this place just a minute from my house and the food is undeniably delicious!

We found Thai Kitchen to be a well keep secret! We chose to enjoy our food at the restaurant. It was quite relaxing..no crowds or music blasting louder than we spoke. My Pineapple Curry was delicious. I will be ordering "to go" many more times!

Please be advised that this is a healthy Thai joint -- hence the name "Brown Rice Thai Kitchen". I ordered Pad Thai with shrimp and spring rolls. The noodles they use are not the typical Pad Thai rice noodles that you're probably used to seeing if you're a Thai food snob. They use wheat & gluten free ingredients so my dish tasted dry/bland. The spring rolls were as normal as can be. The dishes are also way overpriced, but I guess that's expected when you cook with healthier ingredients and you're located in Summerlin. Eat here if you're on a diet, but if you're craving real Thai food then I recommend going to Thai Style Noodle House... It's just another 5 minutes away.

Food was not bad. This was my second time eating here. The first time I tried this place the food was better and I was happy because it's convenient to my place. I ordered the pork pad Thai 6/10 spice level and it was quite bland. I had to add my own mixture of spice to it. The fried rice was pretty good but I've had better. The portions were a pretty good size as well but I would only go here again if I'm desperate for some Thai food and don't feel like driving.

I love this place. Me and my co-workers eat here almost everyday. Food is fresh and flavorful. The owner and staff are lovely, know us by name, and take excellent care of us. One of the best Thai places I've been to.
Tried this restaurant after seeing the reviews on Yelp. Food is great, fresh and hot. Service was excellent. The Pad See Ew is my favorite. Very clean and like the open kitchen.
Fantastic Thai food! This place is my new favorite lunch spot. Everything has really great flavor and spice. Awesome vegetarian dishes too! The eggplant is my favorite!
Everything I've gotten is always delicious. Love the soup, green curry and pad Thai. I believe it is family run, and the staff is always super nice

So-so. Nice grandma home cooking but not would I expect to eat in the the restaurant. Fresh but plain and bland. And pricy for Asian food. Why not ? It's in Summerline, they will buy it anyway. 
Try Thai traditional BBQ on Jones and Flamingo instead.
Tried this place after downloading yelp..the spinach appetizer, Southern Charm noodle dish topped off with the coconut mango was amazing!!!
Overall, I like the food I ordered Pad Thai, and fried duck! and the restaurant is neat. It would be great if the Thai tea has little less ice. I would go back to try more dishes.

I walked in to this place when it opened. I was completely ignored. I stood there for at least 5 minutes. Nobody else was there!! I did no get a chance to try the food. I will not go back. But with customer service like that it won't last long! I would not give it 1 star

We had friends that ate here the other night and really liked it...sooo we gave it a try! The food was soooo ..soooo good!  THe owner is very sweet and came up with the perfect suggestion for my four year old to eat....my Noodles came out spicey and hot....my husbands salad was soooo good! The Ginger dressing  was off the charts!
We are really happy this place moved into our neighborhood!  If you like Thai food...this place is a must try!  
P.S. The portions are not buffet size....which is not good for anyone anyways...the portions are very appropriate for the tummy...you leave there feeling full not stuffed! Which is a VERY good thing!

Healthy Wishes-...The Atamian Family

Worse place Ever! Cheap and bad customer service. I went with my kids since we never tried it we decided to go and give it a shot even though their prices are high. My younger son ordered chicken and rice and my other son The beef curry. Well after paying 30$ for two plates and one drink i took a look at the food and it didnt look like something we could just eat in the car so we started eating it there. Mind you the only one table they have is reserved for employees only! And they have a very small table top with a few small stools. We asked the cashier if we could have some soy sauce which was clearly in front of her and the register when she replied no you don't need soy sauce with the food try it. Ok im thinking im my son is half filipino my son eats soy sauce with everything but she ignored my comment. So i saw there was a lower sodium one on the table top we were sitting at we tasted the chicken and rice first and yep we wanted soy sauce so we used the one next to us when she smerked and made us feel uncomfortable for wanting soy sauce. Now my sons curry was in a soup form and I apologize but this is our first time eating here and we thought we ordeee curry thats mixed with rice not a soup. So i looked at the cashier and kindly asked if we could order the curry rice instead because we just did not like the soup. The cashier then replied with a simple no with no explanation as to why we could or couldn't return the curry. At that moment i grabbed my kids handed the soup back to her and said no thanks we wont be back here ever!!! What kind of customer sevice do they have going at this place. I can see if they were busy but we were the only customers there, now i see why!! No thanks!!
Awesome people!  We are a family with 4 daughters and we frequently count on this restaurant to bail us out of our hectic schedule.  Excellent food and good people!  What more could you ask for?
Best Tom Kha and Chicken Satay I have eaten! They don't use any frozen food at all, so everything tastes fresh because it is.

I absolutely love this place! It's very small, but the food is amazing. I've only had the Chicken Pad See Yew and the Chicken Thai Fried Rice. Both dish has amazing flavors, super affordable. They have a lunch size and a dinner size. The owner is really sweet and friendly. I definitely recommend giving this place a try. It's one of those places where you look at it and you think "um, I'm not too sure about this place" but DO NOT judge a book by its cover! This place is super delicious!

Heads up, even though they have "brown rice" in their name and menu, you have to pay extra when you order it. Say what?! It is a $1 charge to sub brown rice for white rice when you order here. Found that unexpected and backwards.

CRISPY SPINCH APP: Tempura-fried leaves similar to the salad at Nitayas. Portion is pretty similar, dressing isn't as good, leaves were clumped together, but the $4.88 price tag is a lot smaller.
GINGER RICE SOUP: Comforting, large portion is only $8. I like that they pack the rice separately from the soup (I opted for brown). Shrimp version came with four pieces.
EGGPLANT MADE OVER: eggplant and veggie stir fry with chicken, $11. Tasty sauce menu claims is "spicy chili basil". It was tasty, and I liked the basil notes, but this wasn't spicy and I wasn't asked about a spice preference.
PINEAPPLE FRIED RICE: Ordered this with chicken as well, portion was a bit smaller than elsewhere but still quite large. I liked that this version included cashews, which add great texture. Could have used a few more though, only found about five in the entire order.

$40 for Thai takeout dinner for two is a little steep, but resulted in a massive amount of food overall. Note that this spot seems to be strictly grab-and-go, though they do have small stools and a counter lining the room. Call ahead if you can, they were busy when I popped in on a random weeknight but still got the order out quickly.
https://www.ktnv.com/news/dirty-dining/thai-tacos-and-more-on-dirty-dining  C rating for disgusting conditions.

The people here are very grounded, but they run a beautiful restaurant. Tasty, nutritious and authentic whole food. Good for vegans/vegetarians and meat eaters alike.

Also, the 1-10 spice scale lets you spice up your meal to your liking.
Only down side is the price is a bit steep for an entire meal. With that said, you get a value close to two meals
I am from az found this place close to where i am working. Love the pad thai lunch item, great price too. Will be coming back for sure.

I couldn't take a picture because I couldn't stop eating! This was the best Pad See Ewe I have ever had! Mainly due to the fact that the tofu was FIRM not silken like most places use. Silken has no flavor!! The firm absorbed every flavor and was pan fried and tasted like good scrambled eggs instead of deep fried air puffs. The noodles were so so good. Chewy and a nice large portion. 

Very friendly owner. Had her little boy run out my food to the car when it was done. 

I'm so excited to come back. Yum.

Bomb bomb Thai food.  If you dig spicy authentic flavors then you've got to check this place out.  I really appreciate how they balance the flavors, the spicy does not overpower the rest of the dish,  but it builds nicely throughout the meal.  I always get the spicy mint with shrimp,  and it gives me that satisfying spicy flavor while still tasting the delicate sweet shrimp meat flavor. My wife always gets the fresh green curry with chicken,  and it is delicious too! Friendly staff, great food, this is my new go to spot for Thai.

Pineapple stir fry is to die for!  The owners are amazing and she will start to remember your name and order. The price seems high, but the portions are huge. You can share a meal easily. Love this place!

I love that this place is within walking distance to my house. They have DELICIOUS Thai food, and the owners and staff are extremely friendly, and will remember you and your order if you come in often. They have the best traditional Thai red curry and I loved their chicken pad Thai. I would eventually like to try everything on their menu. The food is generally mild over spicy even at a 10, so if you love the heat make sure to express that. She usually gives me some extra chili powder (not sure exactly what it is) so I can make my dishes hotter.
Ordered a pad Thai lunch special to go. It was neatly packed. The noodles are perfect. I would come back in the future.

Delicious and friendly.   Great
Service and great Thai food.   Perfect for take out and they will make special orders with a smile.    I come here about once a week.
Small portions and over priced!!! Food is decent but not worth it. Much better Thai restaurants around.

Horrible is all I have to say. No flavor in any dishes and a orange in my papaya salad?? When I called in my order and started speaking Thai and told me they don't speak Thai I should have known not to order. My own fault for giving this place a try on that account alone.

Really clean cute atmosphere, they have an open kitchen which I always find comforting in any restaurant especially one that primarily does take out and delivery. Its small so I would recommend bringing the whole family to eat but the ginger and rice soup was so good I ate the entire thing. I will return here until I find a better Thai place.

Got take out here last week for the first time. We were impressed with the heavy duty take out containers. Good and sturdy, not that cheap foam containers that leak. Food was great, level 1 spice was good enough for us and the kids. Their pad Thai noodles are a bit different then we were use to but tasted great. Will keep coming back.
Great Thai restaurant in Summerlin. Good portions and priced well. Would recommend trying the Tom Kha and Pad Thai.
Wow, never been to a place that charges you extra for their mess up... plus try to coach me on how many soi sauces I need. Don't know if I'll be back.

This place has gone way down hill... 

The delivery orders forget simple things (literally the brown rice) with no compensation and only a promise to deliver it next time or I can come pick it up... Today I paid $10 for 4 pieces of microwaved broccoli, with some carrots and a small Tom Kha Kai (coconut Soup).   It's just bad now, the counter girl seems to be rude. I am not ordering from them again. 

One thing is also certain they will not be around much longer (like Jaques cafe next store)...    Any good Thai restaurants anybody can recommend in Summerlin area?

So it seems as though I cannot give a review over 5 stars, which this place deserves in my eyes. I enjoy Thai, but I don't looooove it like my bf. Well I think this place has the power to easily change that. 

I went with him on Monday when he went back to Chicago, as this was our final meal together until he visits me (I recently moved here). I got the fried rice, with chicken, mild spicy. I didn't think it would be that spicy but it was freaking HOT. I enjoyed this very much actually. I LOOOVED the flavors in my dish so much. He got the pad thai, which I kept stealing noodles from, I just couldn't get enough! I can't say enough good things because this place just rocks. If you're in the neighborhood, go try it out!

Tried to give this little place to evolve into a great neighborhood joint... Instead it raised its prices within the first month on mediocre food. A couple months later it still is serving Spring rolls stuffed with brown rice not veggies, bad Pad Thai that was too lemony to eat and tasteless chicken. The decor is nearly as bad as the food. When in the area I will dine at one of the neighboring restaurants.
Ordered Pad See Ew #8 spice level. Hardly any heat, was swimming in grease, and missing that sweet smokey flavor.

I love the food in this cute little restaurants. The chicken fried rice is delicious. The chicken is sliced thin and the rice has a soy and kinda sweet flavor. Maybe it's the onions. I've tried just about everything here and have never been let down. Be careful in the heat though. They can spice it up pretty hot. The Thai Tea is really good. There isn't a whole lot of room to sit for dinner and no privacy so I've always gotten food to go. You won't be disappointed. The staff is so sweet and pleasant. I always enjoy stopping in for lunch or dinner.

This place is great! It's clean, healthy, and flavorful. I've had everything from the soups, to the lunch specials all the way to the salads. It's always good and totally affordable, bonus for being quick and my order is always correct when I get it home. Jann, the owner is just a total gem, she's friendly and has no problem answering questions when you call for take out. Bonus for delicious Thai coffee and Thai tea! We eat here on a regular basis and will continue to.

I really enjoy the food here. I love the Pork Pad Thai and the Chicken Panang Curry. It's a very small place. You order at the counter and it's always the same lady. I believe she's the owner. Her name is Jennifer?? She's always very nice. 

There's only 2 small tables and a diner style countertop that faces a wall. With that said, I order take out. 

I definitely recommend it if you're looking for some good Thai take out and want to support a small local business.

Ordered takeout over the phone on a Saturday afternoon, and the process was a little haphazard. Was a little worried whether they'd get the order right once we got there. We ordered the Thai fried rice lunch special with chicken (which comes with a delicious side of miso dressing salad, and slices of orange, cucumber, and tomato), as well as the ginger rice soup which was decent. 

Fortunately, they did get the order right, and it tasted delicious.

Oddly though, they gave it to us in a bottomed out coca cola box(?) that was pretty cumbersome instead of a bag, and threw in a few plastic utensils on the side. 

Also seems they've gladly gotten rid of (or perhaps just forgot with us on our latest visit?) the practice of forcing you to tip at least 15% on the tablet after you've swiped your card.

Although the customer service could have been a little better, the food here is so good! I got the pad thai lunch special w/ tofu and it was definitely one of the best pad thai dishes I have ever had. They are also pretty fast at making the order so that is always a plus!

We found this small Thai Restaurant that we had never been to before. My husband got chicken wings and I got pad Thai. We both plan on going back! The people are friendly and the food was the delicious. It Reminds us of our favorite restaurants in Alaska. We would definitely go back!

I just happened to be in this neighborhood when I seen this place... I love Thai food so I went on Yelp to check them out and seen they had good reviews... I had the lunch special "Traditional Thai Curry" with shrimp and yellow curry and it was very good and tasty. I'll go out of my way next time to eat here again...... and just to note, the place was very clean..

Needs lot  of improvement. .. crispy spinach for too oily. Chicken satay were horrible. Peanut sauce was like water. Their meat in the curries was very tough. Their pricing is also not right. They are charging  $11 for main entree. It is much higher price than some of the best Thai places that charge $9.95 for the main entree and their food is much better than Brown Rice Thai.
Not going there again. I have crossed this off from my list.

Super location and delicious food!  I had the chicken Thai curry with brown rice and it was light and fresh with tons of flavor!!  Loved it!!  Food runs very mild.  Ordered a 7 the first time and a ten the second and only at the "10" was it finally spicy.

  Update - I have now eaten here about ten times and it is consistently WAY TOO MILD.  I specifically told her that today and ordered my dish at an 11, it is maybe a 4.  Won't be going back.

Update 2- finally got the heat right glad I kept trying, 14 was the magic number to get hot enough.

My family and I have been coming to this place twice a week for the past year. We love the food! It is hands down the best Thai food we have ever had. It's authentic, the owners super friendly and anytime someone comes to visit, this is where we bring them.

Food:  is flavorful and fresh.  I had the pineapple and onion chicken, papaya salad, and thai iced tea which were all good.  The portions are a little on the light side, though.

Service:  I got take out, so can only observe that the food arrived in a reasonable amount of time and the deliver person was nice and professional.

Value:  is their greatest weakness.  My bill was $29 before tip, which is quite steep for the amount of food I bought.  While this is a solid place, I don't think it has the best value.

This area of Summerlin has so few decent restaurants. There's not much to choose from if you're trying to avoid nasty chain restaurants. Brown Rice Thai Kitchen is one of the few alternatives. Unfortunately, it's not much of an upgrade. Chicken pad Thai was uninspired and bland. The pineapple fried rice with chicken was an improvement. Plenty of veggies and well seasoned chicken were mixed in with a hefty amount of rice. Seating is limited to stools lining two of the walls. This is more of a takeout spot serving the area than a place to sit in and dine.

Found this place on yelp. Didnt even know it existed less than half a mile from my house.
Very fresh food had shrimp soup and thai salad. Small place with husband wife team.
Glad I found this hidden Gem. They never use MSG too.

My favorite thai food resturaunt in the world, have been to many other world class thai resturaunts and thai kitchen is my favorite. The owner, Jaan is a wonderful woman. The food is always consistent, i've been coming here for years now. a must try for sure.
Fantastic Family Owned Thai place in the Vons Shopping Center. Friendly service and great food. We had the Pad Thai and fried spinach and I recommend both!

Love coming here. The pad Thai, crispy spinach, fried rice, and yellow curry are delicious. The price is right and the portions are reasonable. I.T is right near my school, so I'm always eating there. The workers there are extremely nice and will recognize your voice and call you by your first name if your a regular customer calling in an order.
I am a fan, the lady here is super nice too.  Solid and legit Thai in Summerlin!
Delicious. Quality ingredients. Friendly staff. Reasonable prices. Well done Brown Rice!!

The food was great and the people working here are very friendly. My girlfriend and I had the Pork Pad Thai and the Chicken Stir Fry in Peanut Sauce. Food is made when you order and all of the ingredients are fresh. It took about 15-20 minutes for them to finish our order, which was for takeout. Thai Ice Tea was also great.
Wow, this is f*cked up. I asked for light ice in my tea, and the lady charges me $1 and didn't tell me.
Our favorite Thai restaurant in town. The food is consistently good. Our favorite is the cashew chicken or pad Thai.

Nice find tonight. Watching a show with Thai food and then it was time to search Yelp. Right in our neighborhood was this place that delivered. Sorry, but 35 degrees outside and delivery sounded great. Our food arrived in quick order, piping hot and most of all, delicious.  Shrimp dumpling, spring rolls, fried rice, curry and a noodle dish. All were scrumptious. Really delicious. Entire family loved the meal. Nice job and delivery too!

I am so glad I decided to eat here. I thought it was just take out but there are a few seats to enjoy a great Thai lunch.
I had the Pad See-eew and it was so delicious. I wanted more! I want to try all items on the menu here. Haha!
The food was cooked fresh and truly authentic Thai taste.
I will be back in future to try other favorites.

Was visiting Las Vegas and stopped by on the way to go hiking. Ordered the Pad Thai (spicy) and Thai Ice Coffee. Service was fast and owner was very nice. Food was hot and very Tasty! Will definitely return the next time I am in Vegas.

This place is a hidden gem! The employees are so nice, the food is amazing! Seriously, you need to come try this place. I had just started working in the area and all the girls I worked with would constantly talk about the pad Thai here and I just had to try it out and I'm glad I did! You will not be disappointed!
I get food from here all the time! Amazing service and food! Pad Woon Sen is my favorite!

Delicious! I've only had a few things so far, but I'm already addicted to the Pad Thai. I Iove that the (I'm assuming) owner is knowledgeable about gluten and has a close friend who has gluten sensitivity. She's super nice and easy to ask questions of, and that goes a long way when I'm used to being treated as a nuisance because of my food allergies. 

The Pad Thai is very flavorful, with plenty of sauce. This is wonderful, because when I ordered gluten-free pad Thai at Archie's, it was super dry (they make it w/ soy sauce and they have to leave it off because it has wheat). I'm so happy that I don't have to sacrifice flavor!!!

The price may be slightly high, but I get two meals out of it, so it seems like a good value to me! I am looking forward to some of the curries and soups next time. Just wish they were open on Sunday, but on this sleepy side of Summerlin I can understand why they aren't.

Tried this place last night. Not bad nothing overly great about it. Just another take out spot with average food. Brown rice is like a $1 more. Very small with nice atmosphere. Service was friendly. Wouldn't go out my way to get there. If I'm in the area and feel like having Thai I would stop in again.

I crave this place ALL the time!!!! Their food is so fresh and delicious! The Pineapple fried rice is amazing as is everything else I've ever tried on their menu. The people who work here are so friendly and remember exactly how I like my order!!!! Love this place

Food is really good. They have a nice selection of choices to pick from. Their shrimp dumplings are really great, wish there were more than just four though. Their service is not all that great, they are a little impatient and it wasn't even busy. A little small on the inside, but they do have take-out. The spicy food you can choose which level you like. Overall, great food, needs better service though.

Brown Rice Thai Kitchen is my absolute favorite restaurant on the planet. When you walk in you are welcomed by the aroma the delicious food being prepared in the kitchen. You are greeted by a woman standing behind the orange counter. Odds are that that woman behind the counter has exactly what you order memorized. Amazing food for a reasonable price. Extremely authentic Thai. 10/10. 

SIDE NOTE: order chicken pad thai with a thai tea. the crispy spinach is delightful as well.

I love this place. We eat here weekly as does my mom!  Their Thai Tea is addictive.. and this place is really really amazing.  The husband and wife who own and cook here are extraordinary.  If they are not there the food is not as good, but that is few and far between.  I love this place.  Its my #1.

3 1/2 but rounding up to 4

Smack dab in the middle of the burbs, this small, fast casual, neighborhood Thai place is a good alternative to all the chain restaurants that are abundant in the area.  It's also convenient for us since it's only about a half mile away from the house.  The service was friendly and helpful and the prices are fair.  The place is pretty small and it's nice that the kitchen is open and right there so you can watch your food being prepared.

We ordered two noodle dishes, a Pad Thai with shrimp and a Pad Kee Mow (wide flat noodle) both were $9.  If you ordered the noodles with Chicken, Pork, Vegetables, or Tofu, it would be $8.  We also ordered Spring Rolls which were $3.68 and came with two rolls and a dipping sauce...the Spring Rolls were vegetarian friendly since the filling has no meat.

All the dishes were O.K.. The filling in the Spring Rolls were a bit on the mushy side but the flavor was there and the rice paper wrapping was fairly light and crunchy.  My Pad Kee Mow tasted good, it just had too much sliced onion mixed in which threw off the flavor balance a bit.  I ended up picking some of them out.  Mark H thought his Pad Thai was so so.  He said the shrimp was good but the sauce overall was too sweet.

After being exhausted from driving all day from Sacramento,  a convenient and quick place nearby is a welcomed thing for sure.  Would be worth coming back to.

This is one of my favorite Thai locations. Its a bit hidden and the location is built more for take out unless you want to dine in solo. The quality and taste is exceptional. Cooked almost right in front of you the best way for me to describe the taste is light and fresh. Pad Thai, Pad See Ew, Yellow Curry and piles of white rice are a few of the dishes I have conquered in repetition here. They all share a light fresh flavor regardless of spice level and I appreciate this. There is also a lack of ''synthetic'' flavor in the food which I am thankful for. I love the staff here and would like to give a special mention to the staff who always remembers my name down to my menu choices. They are very friendly despite long hours over a wok, and that means something. Take out and delivery is available along with tasty Thai Tea on the way out the door.

P.S I love their Ginger Dressing!!

I found this place on Yelp. I  was super hungry so I decided to try the new Thai restaurant. I am not impressed after spending $20 for rolls, and pineapple fried rice.  I usually eat at Archi's, and I love their food. I thought the portions to be too small for the price. I agree with other reviews that shared the same concern. I will drive the distance to my old favorite.

This place is authentic Thai! Jen is the best! I typically order the red curry which is delicious and sometimes get a Thai iced coffee (it's very sweet, so it's definitely a dessert) I highly recommend this place!

Went here for lunch. Staff is friendly and service is prompt. Lunch portion was good for lunch. 

I had Pangang Curry with chicken and side of rice. I only noticed that my "brown rice" was just lined, the inside of my rice was actually white rice, once I broke the shape to spread the curry and chicken over it. Not sure if they did that because I am Asian and love / prefer white rice, or that is there same MO. I only had it once and if costumer are ordering Brown rice Thai food to be healthy or other dietary restrictions, I would expect it all to be brown rice. no? Therefore 1 star deduction. Otherwise I am very happy with this place. Their Tea machine is the best, love the sweetened green tea. I will come back - maybe for a noodle dish this time.

I love this place! Not only is the food super delicious and healthy.. But the owners are wonderful! They are salt of the earth people! I frequent this neighborhood gem almost daily for their soup! I'm known as the "soup lady" lol.. Everything I've tried is delicious! But their Tom Yum Noodle soup is fave! And the Tom Ka is favorite too. Jen (owner) is always so sweet and gives wonderful customer service.
I will continue to support this wonderful little spot! :D

My favortie Thai place in Las Vegas!! You HAVE TO order the egg fried rice when you go, it's to die for! The rice comes in a huge portion that can feed 2 or 3 people. Along with the rice I usually order chicken satay which is never short of amazing. There is so much flavor in the food and the owner's and staff are so friendly and welcoming. Also try the Thai iced coffee if you need a pick me up!

terrible! on "dirty dining" show on channel 13 news last night feb. 25th, 2018 with  34 demerits  takes 36  to be shut down.
i got soup there a couple of weeks ago and it tasted old, now i know why!!! 
i wouldn't even give one star but you have to give at least that!

Food here tastes great and healthy!! I get carry out but the place looks pretty clean, I have no complaints. I've had the pad thai, drunken noodles, spring rolls. They give you a lot of veggies too which I love. The only thing I would say is it's a little pricey but you get what you pay for!
pretty good for takeout Thai. portions were a perfect dinner and leftover lunch size.

Love this place. My GF and I have been eating since we moved to Summerlin and they always make the best food. Best Pad See Ew I have ever had, seriously. Staff is great and prices are reasonable. Would recommend.
Service was great, but food was too speedy and not near spice level I asked for. Woulsnt try again

Brown Rice Thai was good and they had a yummy peanut sauce dish. I was a little disappointed in the portion sizes for the price, but overall it was good. I would definitely recommend this place and return.

Brown Rice Thai Kitchen has the worst Thai food we've ever tried -- and we have eaten a lot of Thai food.  The Tum Yum soup had whole cherry tomatoes and big cuts of button mushrooms and barely anything else. We were shocked when we opened our take-out. The Shrimp Panang Curry ($13) was very watery and soupy -- major disappointment.  Don't waste your money here.

This is my go-to restaurant for delicious Thai food! I've tried other Thai restaurants in the area and none compare to Brown Rice Thai Kitchen. I always get the Pineapple Fried Rice with crispy tofu and I have a hard time not devouring the whole container in one sitting! My husband has tried the curries and other rice dishes and he agrees with me that this place is the best!

Driving around Summerlin, NV., we decided to check this place out. As we were walking in, a woman told us it was the best Thai food in the area. We were not disappointed. It looks like a dive inside, but the food was great. Had the Pad Thai and chicken satay appetizer. This is authentic Thai food so check it out if you are in the area.

It's a little expensive. The pineapple fried rice with chicken is very very very good. I highly recommend it. Their pad Thai is also very good. I'd argue it's one of the most flavorful Thai places in Summerlin.

I got the pad thai, wife got the fried rice.....while somewhat satisfying, we both found our dishes to be lacking in the flavor department....particularly the chicken. My pad Thai also seemed to be almost all noodles......I can't believe I'm saying this, but I wanted more vegetables. The "restaurant" itself was more of a take out counter, no indoor seating. At ~ $11 a dish, we probably won't come back here the next time we get a Thai craving.

food - food was pretty tasty. It has some original flavor a. I ordered a 1 spice level and it was not hot at all. Some places give me a spicy flavor at 1 but but I would step this one up a couple of notches. The servicing size was enough for me which was not enough for the price I paid. Usually, I share with my son or have left overs but this time there were no left overs. I'm not a fatty when it comes to portion size but I've paid the same for more food. I guess location has to do with this. Food was still good but not sure if id return just for the food.

service - the cashier was nice. However after you are served your food do t expect them to ask how is your food and if you want anything else. The owners seem a little cheap to me for what I paid for. This place was a cross between fast food and a sit down restaurant. I also had to clear my own plate and place it in a bucket. I understand we are helping the restaurant out but again, this is where the fast food joint comes to mind. I expected a little more. There was also a bar with little stools as an option to sit down at. I wasn't impressed with this as I came here to enjoy a lunch with a colleague.

I only visit because of convenience in location, it's close to work and I can be in an out to pick up my order in 10-15 minutes.   Besides convenience I have nothing good to say.  The food always disappoints. I love Thai food, but this place keeps disappointing my taste buds with lack of flavor. In addition, I know I ordered a small soup, at least fill up the container.  I don't appreciate receiving half the size of a small order of Tom Yum that taste like nothing but fish oil.  Never again, today was the last straw. I keep giving it one more shot, but not anymore.
The small portioned and overpriced entree is served in tin foil which is a first to me.........I don't think so!
Love this place. The owner is super nice and the food is amazing. My go to is the pad woon sen and I always get a side of the garlic fish sauce, it's addicting! My favorite Thai place in town'

It's not as easy as you'd think to find Thai that isn't greasy or has the right idea of mild, medium, and spicy.

This place was a little more expensive than most, but when you see the women who make your food you can understand why. It's authentic, made with love, and a good portion. 

The pad Thai that I ordered was phenomenal. It's probably going to be a craving! We also ordered side salads and while there lettuce is HUGE, the ginger dressing is delicious.

I'm probably spoiled by the Thai options living in Spring Valley. After a recent job change, now I work in Summerlin and need to determine what places belong in the lunch spot rotation. Brown Rice won't make the cut.

I got the pad thai beef lunch special, which is a good barometer dish to compare Thai restaurants. Portion size was fair for a lunch special. The food quality reminds me of Fazoli's. Fazoli's isn't bad, but you really only go there in a pinch if there's no other better Italian option. Same goes for Brown Rice in relation to Thai food.
Just opened yesterday...this place is a gem! So happy they're here, the food was amazing! I think I found a new Thai place in Summerlin! Definitely recommend the Pad Thai! Amazing!!!
Wow. This place rocks. Reasonable quick and just delicious. I had the larb salad chicken satay and crispy tofu. All were so delicious the larb was killer perfect combination of hot and savory.

Delicious Thai food! This is a great place to call ahead and pick up an order. There's not a lot of seating inside so I wouldn't necessarily go there to eat. But the Panang Curry is awesome! It's a nice balance of sweet and spicy. They also have perfectly cooked brown rice which is very difficult to get. The staff here is very friendly.

This is one of the best Thai food restaurants in Summerlin. All the employees are very nice and always friendly. The owner knows me and is always very sweet to me and my family. They have awesome pad see eww. I give it a 5/5. 

Update: the food is still as good as it was. Just wanted to let you know!

Good food,  very nice people but the portions are very small for the price. Everything I tried I like a lot but just  small in potion size and not enough meat!! I did notice the prices went up already which is kinda odd since its newly opened !
I only speak for the thai tea but as a non-thai person, it was delicious. I've never drank anything so fast.

Well... the people seemed kind and really nice... 
I walked in picked up our to go order then headed home. As soon as we pulled in my partner receives a call. After being accused of giving the woman at the counter the wrong "name", it turned out i was handed the wrong order... 
As if i would get my own name wrong.
 They said that they would come and drop off our correct order "oh by the way you owe us $9"

The not only brushed responsibility for their mistake, but also up charged us the $9 difference. 

45 minutes later... the food however was good in flavor. Their curry to watery. 

The flavor of their food isn't good enough for me to want to go back to such a place of business.

I will take my business elsewhere. 

Maybe next year ill give them a second try...

The initial caution is that they have no rhyme or reason to their 1-10 scale of spicy. Other than that, the food and service are excellent. I have eaten here dozens of times for lunch with no issues on service or food quality.
For $20 food I would rather go to Thai BBQ. The servings here are to small for the price.
The best Thai food I've had.  The owner is sweet and the service is great.  It's mostly take out, but they do have a few tables for eat in.

I have never seen such care taken when packing a to-go order. Fresh and neatly packed. I ordered steamed broccoli and chicken with a side of brown rice. Perfect lunch portion and freshly prepared. Will be back!
Quick, efficient, and exceeded my flavor expectations. For being tucked away in a strip mall this is worth making the trip. Lunch Special Yellow Chicken Curry! Under $9

Let me start by saying that I never give a five rating. Or I never have you given a five rating. So the four that I'm giving Thai Brown Rice Kitchen is really good for me! One of my favorite foods is papaya salad. another is any kind of curry. We came here and had both and they're both really good. The place was also clean. The owner, who also works here, is super nice. I went to check out the bathroom, but there is none. It is takeout and delivery only. But, nevertheless, this is the place to go!

Another great lunch. Panang curry on a cool fall day. Delicious! This little mom and pop place is great. Never had a bad meal here. Always tastes great. Good service too. Definitely hit this spot for a tasty quick lunch. Authentic flavors, made to order. Spice it up a bit.

I ordered Pad Thai with beef A La Cart. First thing I noticed was it was a small portion.  Second thing was there wasn't much beef. Beef was a little tough but for the most part it was tasty. Different from many Thai places.

I also ordered a large Tom Yum soup with chicken. Standard size amount. This too was prepared differently than most places. Chicken was tough and flavor was ehhhh 

Place has seats for inside eating but restaurant is designed for take out.

Small portion sizes along with the cost makes this an undesirable place for me to return. For $23 ...I expected more

I don't get the 4 star rating! I'm a huge lover of thai food and this place misses the mark. But let's start with the rude service first. I don't know how the owner was nice to everyone else but she was super nasty to me. I ordered my food and told her it was for here, and even ordered a drink. My daughter and I shared the pad thai. We sat down and she gives it to me in a to go bag, so either she didn't hear me or what I think is the real reason...she wanted me out of there. I noticed that the two guys eating in there had like plastic bento boxes. When I got up to get a napkin I notice that they actually have real dishes that they put away for people, and here I got my food in the good old styrofoam box. I searched for a fork, she only gave me one--so I ask for another she gives me the nastiest look! My daughter even said, wow. She makes me lean all the way across to counter to get it because god forbid she walk over to me in reaching distance. I'm seriously leaning over the counter with my arm stretched out as far as it can go and my fingertips barely touch the fork. Does that make her move closer? Hell no. I finally get the fork and we eat. She stared at us the entire time like I killed her pet or something. Very uncomfortable. I said thank you and nothing. She's a royal you know what. On to the food, the most flavorless pad Thai ive ever had. There are so many other thai restaurants close enough that you would never ever need to step foot in this one. It's tasteless. The only reason you may like it is if you don't frequently eat Thai, so you don't have anything to compare it with. I wouldn't eat in there anyway, it's small quarters. I swear I saw a cockaroach. My advice pass this place up and go somewhere else. 


The fact that I gave this honest review of my personal experience and the restaurant owners and friends of the owner sent me nasty messages through Yelp is deplorable, attacking me as a person for simply not enjoying their food or customer service, nasty people. These are the types that would spit in your food
Great Food the Chicken Pad Thai is awesome every time.

Ordered super late, I didn't realize they were closing in 15 minutes. Even so, they took my order and when I showed up everything was ready to go! I definitely enjoyed my fried rice with shrimp. I always order extra shrimp and this place isn't stingy with it. The veggie egg rolls were ok, they tasted more like reheated ones than freshly made. I'd still return to get Thai here for sure. 

No pics. I smashed.

At first I was surprised by the use of tinfoil but it kept my meal nice and hot all the way. Next time I need to order spicer!! Noodles were moist and delightful.  
Pad Tai lunch special $9 and made fresh to order - I will be back.

I absolutely love this place! I order food from Jan many times a week. She is the best and this is a wonderful family owned business and the food is fantastic and the service is great too! I love the Thai soups especially the Tom Ka and Thai chicken noodle soup. I often pick up four or more and eat them all week for lunch and dinner at home. What a gem!

As a local restaurant down the block form me I only wish the best for them. When I order from on line menus it shows crunchy duck.  This is something I really think I would enjoy, but the restaurant tells me they no longer have a duck supplier. Ok guys then take the item out of your menus. I have tried other items only to find the food to be ok. Nothing I have to have every night it you know what I mean. Please get duck!  Thank you
